Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> one more doubt is, isn't it the case that, the round betting always stops at the player who raised the last?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢> that page looks like it covers everything if you look at all of the posts and I think the graphic makes a good visual aid
`the round betting always stops at the player who raised the last?`
the "round" *starts* with the player that raised last and ends with the player to their immediate right (if no one else re-raises)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> okay, isn't it that the round always start with the player left to the dealer...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> apart from the pre flop round which start with the player left to big blind

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢> `isn't it that the round always start with the player left to the dealer...`
initially, yes; however, once someone raises a "new round" begins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> when i play poker here: https://replaypoker.com

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢> there can be many "sub-rounds" (for lack of better wording) in each "round" of betting

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> in this once the flop  or turn or river cards are drawn, the betting is starting from the player left to the dealer..

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢> correct
I guess what I was saying would apply as a "sub-round"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> okay got it, so if a player A raises and all other players just perform the call, even in that case also player A won't be allowed to raise again right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢> correct, if all are calls then you cannot re-raise yourself

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> okay, one more doubt is, isn't the case we need to fix small_blind before start of the game?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> or we can allow dynamic bet on small_blind?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢> `if a player A raises and all other players just perform the call` then the betting will end with the active player to their immediate right

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> agreed, it means for that round the betting is over, depending up on the state of the game, next community cards will be drawn...right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢> `we need to fix small_blind before start of the game?
or we can allow dynamic bet on small_blind?`
the "standard" is set big and small; there are "house rules" that apply in some places, but generally blinds are fixed amount

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢> 1&2 5&10 3&6 etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> got it thanks, so the maximum rounds of betting rounds is 4?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> 1) after hole cards are drawn 2) after flop cards 3) after turn card 4) after river card

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢> Small is "generally" 1/2 of big
if you count a "round" as it relates to the card action then, yes, you have 4
preflop
post-flop
post-turn
post-river

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> okay, yes, we will fix small/big blinds to something like 1/2 satoshis for time being on LN..

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> thanks a lot for clarifying the doubts.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <jl777c> a question for the community is what games we want to see CHIPS supporting. we are working toward a table driven game definition, so once a specific type of game is implemented, then similar variants would be supported with the creation of a new set of data that describes the game rules.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <jl777c> i estimate 100+ different games can be supported, but we want to support the games that people want to play
